intro: Inversodicraea thollonii, commonly known as the Madagascar spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a shrub native to Madagascar, characterized by its succulent, ribbed stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
